sentences.en: An interpreter must n't upstage the speaker.
sentences.cn: 翻译不应该抢发言人的风头.

sentences.en: Apple may well upstage all of them by announcing its own tablet - like device in January.
sentences.cn: 苹果公司宣布明年1月将[推出]自己的平板 式 阅读器,所有[同类产品]很可能会相形见绌.

sentences.en: He tried to upstage his boss at the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他在会议期间尽力显得比上司突出.
他对陌生人很冷漠,爱搭不理的.
在舞台后面安置一部摄影机。

sentences.en: She crossed to the upstage chair forcing the lead to turn his back to the audience.
sentences.cn: 她横穿到舞台后方的椅子,迫使男主人公背对着观众.

sentences.en: The actor moved upstage away from the audience.
sentences.cn: 演员移向舞台后部,离观众越来越远.

sentences.en: The dancers were directed to move upstage.
sentences.cn: 舞蹈演员渐渐移向舞台前方.

sentences.en: They slowly moved from upstage left into the centre.
sentences.cn: 他们慢慢地从舞台后方的左侧移至正中。

sentences.en: They're much too upstage for us these days.
sentences.cn: 他们近来对我们太势利了.

sentences.en: Upstage and right of centre, Robert Morris stands with his back to the audience.
sentences.cn: 舞台后方偏右处，罗伯特·莫里斯背对观众站着。

trans.tran_cn: 舞台后部的，<口>傲慢的，自负的
向舞台后部，在舞台后部
抢戏，抢镜头，使相形见绌，傲慢地对待
